alert.note: Alert for Jefferson; San Juan (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 29 at 1:04PM PDT by NWS Seattle
info.description: .A line of showers and thunderstorms is persisting over the area with rain and some heavy downpours. The line of thunderstorms will slowly move eastward over the next few hours and eventually out of the area. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM PDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northwest Washington, including the following counties, Jefferson and San Juan. * WHEN...Until 400 PM PDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 100 PM PDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 0.2 and 0.6 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.2 to 0.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Port Townsend, Friday Harbor, Roche Harbor, Eastsound, Waldron Island, Port Hadlock-Irondale and Chimacum. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
